hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\greenD{6}} = \purpleC{{?}} \div \maroonD{{7}}$, the $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{6}$.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{7}}$.

![Tape diagram showing question mark is equal to 6 equal groups of 7](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7f803c85896fc19992d6d704d609e561332da3d2)

The $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{?}$.

Lew can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{{?}} = \greenD{6} \times \maroonD{{7}}$
- $\purpleC{{?}} = \maroonD{7} \times \greenD{{6}}$

question.content:
Lew wants to use multiplication to solve $6 = {?} \div 7$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Lew use?**
